metadata.title: CVE-2011-3241 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
WebKit, as used in Apple iTunes before 10.5, allows man-in-the-middleattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) via vectors related to iTunes Storebrowsing, a different vulnerability than other CVEs listed inAPPLE-SA-2011-10-11-1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 22.0
chromium-browser-l10n - 22.0
chromium-chromedriver - 22.0
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 22.0
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 22.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '22.0').
